post: How did democracy expand, and what challenges came with it, in the early 1800s? Our new middle school lesson, America in Transition, uses George Caleb Binghams County Election to explore freedom, equality, and civic virtue in a changing nation. 🎥 Watch now:  https://bit.ly/4hjhrI5  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #MiddleSchool

Congratulations to National Civics Teacher of the Year finalist Elizabeth Purtell (Heritage Academy, AZ)! She equips 8th graders with sourcing, bias-spotting, and civil discourse skills, then channels them into real civic action. Read Elizabeths spotlight:  https://bit.ly/47azL2V  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice

Civic Star fits a wide variety of subjects. Flexible, classroom‑ready activities tied to Americas 250th. Log 1 in minutes and your class is eligible for prizes. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #TeachingResources  #CivicEducation  #America250

Classrooms run best when students can focus. In this new video, leaders from FileWave and TRUCE discuss safer, more productive device use, and why backing civics teachers matters. Were proud to thank FileWave, in partnership with TRUCE Software, for sponsoring the National Civics Teacher of the Year award. Watch and weigh in:  https://bit.ly/496POjk  #CivicEducation  #EdTech  #TeacherAwards  #StudentSuccess  #K12

Small gifts, big reach: $10 equips 10 students. $25 powers a class set. $100 helps a grade level. Every dollar = a Pocket Constitution in a students hands. Give for your state:  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #Philanthropy  #CivicEducation  #SupportTeachers

Conference season is here, and BRI is on the road. From OK to FL, GA, MO & TX, were sharing standards‑aligned civics tools, BRI Jr., and game‑based Government & Politics. Which PD should we bring to your state? Tell us below. 🔗  https://bit.ly/43eqOD4  #CivicEducation  #TeacherPD  #SocialStudies

Small wins add up. Each logged classroom activity = another entry in the Civic Star Challenge. Start with 1 this week, stack from there. 300+ chances to win this year. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #StudentEngagement  #America250

⚔️  #OTD 1859: Abolitionist John Brown led a raid on the federal arsenal at Harpers Ferry, hoping to spark a slave revolt. The raid failed, but it intensified national divisions over slavery. How can we help students debate whether Brown was a martyr, a radical, or both? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/4qbgjdv  #TDiH  #JohnBrown  #Slavery  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory

Every great movement begins with 1 idea. Through the MyImpact Challenge, students nationwide are turning their ideas into civic action, improving communities and living out Americas Founding Principles. 💡 Share or nominate a student:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #StudentLeadership  #CivicEngagement  #CivicEducation

Please join us in congratulating National Civics Teacher of the Year finalist Hanna Kairschner (Benton High School, LA)! She empowers students to think for themselves, practice empathy, and make informed choices rooted in the Constitution and civic participation. 🔗  https://bit.ly/47mD32U  #CivicEducation  #StudentVoice
